title: 820-00165 - Minor damage on/around Q3510
message:
There was damage on Q3510, R3512, so i replaced those two, and also replaced U3510, 

When i plug in charger after about 5 seconds fan does a small kick/spin, 

Any ideas, thank you guys in advance


PPVCORE_S0_CPU: 0V
PPVCORE_S0_AXG: 0V

PPBUS_G3H: 12.59V
PP3V42_G3H: 3.431V
PPVRTC_G3H: 3.336V
PP5V_S5: 5.035V
PP3V3_S5: 3.341V
PP5V_S4: 0V

PP3V3_S4: pulses twince when plug in then drops to 0.50v
PP5V_S3: pulses twince when plug in then drops to 0.0v
PP3V3_S3: pulses twince when plug in then drops to 0.50v


PM_SLP_S4: pulses once at plug in

SMC_BC_ACOK: 3.4V
SMC_PM_G2_EN: 3.4V
PM_BATLOW_L:3.32v
SMC_ADAPTER_EN: 3.4V
PM_SLP_SUS_L: 3.32V

SMC_ONOFF_L: 3.429V

title: 820-00165 - Minor damage on/around Q3510
message:
Check if all secondary coils pulse; maybe not from CPU.
ALL_SYS_PWRGD pulses too?

Use R5115/16 pads instead of power button.
Check signals reaction every time.

Try to start in SMC bypass also...

title: 820-00165 - Minor damage on/around Q3510
message:
ALL_SYS_PWRGD - when i plug power cord pulses 3.4v twice then stops.

when i use R5115/16 pads ALL_SYS_PWRGD goes to 0.57v then back to 0v

pardon my stupidity, but i do not know how to start in SMC bypass :(

title: 820-00165 - Minor damage on/around Q3510
message: Resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of the ISL6259? Corrosion near U1900, U6100, or U1950?

title: 820-00165 - Minor damage on/around Q3510
message:
Press power button (or use R5115/16 pads instead), connect magsafe and mantain pressed 5-10s.
Google also knows that...

title: 820-00165 - Minor damage on/around Q3510
message:
Resistance between pins 17/18 - 3.5 ohms and 27/28 - 20 ohms of the [URL="https://store.rossmanngroup.com/isl6259ahrtz.html"]ISL6259[/URL]

Corrosion near [URL="https://store.rossmanngroup.com/e1-slg3nb148cv.html"]U1900[/URL], U6100, or U1950, NONE AT ALL

it was all clean except on Q3510

title: 820-00165 - Minor damage on/around Q3510
message: How about SMC bypass like was asked? Do this by disconnecting all power sources (Battery + Magsafe) and having the power button pressed (or with R5115/16) while plugging the charger in. Keep the button pressed until the device powers on, if it doesn't do that after 15 seconds you can give up because it should've started already. Make 100% Sure the power button (or eqv.) is pressed when any power source is applied or the SMC will be booted and you would need to disconnect all power again first

title: 820-00165 - Minor damage on/around Q3510
message: SMC bypass still not coming on,

title: 820-00165 - Minor damage on/around Q3510
message:
Check resistors and traces around SPI chip U6100.
Also try new BIOS, just in case...
